article_html: Until recently, the extraction of shale gas through the process of fracking has only faced serious opposition from anti-fracking campaigners who argue that the process is harmful to the environment. But now the shale gas industry is facing a new challenge from the tumbling price of oil. In the US, some fracking supporters are trying to reframe the debate as a geo-political matter in an oil-price war with the Middle East
text: Until recently, the extraction of shale gas through the process of fracking has only faced serious opposition from anti-fracking campaigners who argue that the process is harmful to the environment. But now the shale gas industry is facing a new challenge from the tumbling price of oil. In the US, some fracking supporters are trying to reframe the debate as a geo-political matter in an oil-price war with the Middle East
title: How fracking for shale gas is becoming a foreign policy issue – video
